moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d5 3. exd5: Don´t remember how to play against this one. Is going to be one of those funny chaotic opening games!
moves.3... e4 4. Ne5: Sorth of an Alejine knight opening here
moves.5. d4 Nf6 6. Nc3: Not just holding the pawn, but trying to activate my own pieces
moves.6... O-O 7. Bc4: Need to do the castling asap, I think. I was also planning on delaying it and doing it on the queen´s side, but requires too many moves.
moves.7... c5: Didn´t see this. I thought 7...Nbd7 was a good one, since there is 8...Nb6 if  change is not accepted; and if so, black has a strong attack on the king´s side.
moves.8. O-O: Knowing that black will activate his rook after cxd, but castling seemed to be a priority here.
moves.8... cxd4 9. Qxd4 Re8 10. f4: Only one left I think. N in e5 is centered but fixed also.
moves.10... b6: Threats Bc5 and also wins a time to develop white B in b7. But I don´t feel like Bb7 is as active as guarding c8-h5. But gaining a time anyways.
moves.11. Be3 Bb7 12. Qd2: I didn´t feel like giving up my pawn, but I thought it was going to be the safest move. Also I found out (After I made the move) that I had a nice attack if Bxd5.
moves.13. fxe5 Rxe5 14. Bd4 Re8: In case of 14...e3; 15.Qe2 gives even better chances to white after Bxf6
moves.15. Bxf6 gxf6 16. Qh6 Nd7: Best and only one, I think. With the idea of Nf8 or Ne5 and then Ng3
moves.17... Re5: Didn´t see this one either; as I said, I thought there would be a N movement here, but seems to work 15.Re5
moves.18... Qf8: Good one! I spent most of my time here trying to find a good combination, but to no avail. I didn´t want to end up with one extra pawn only out of this nice position.
moves.19. Rg4+: But maybe there is not much more to do. Now R is not pressing on f6 and the check seems to be a waste.
moves.19... Kh8: Queen needs to move and if exchanged, I lose even that pawn I didn´t feel it was enough before! Tables have turned for me now. What to do, what to do?...
moves.20. Qf4: So I tried to keep the pressure up and thought about moving 21.Ng4 in case of 20...f5, but it was a complicated situation, and did not see it clear.
moves.20... f5 21. Nf6: But instead did this one. Seems is not as good as the other one
moves.21... fxg4: The bad one. The great mistake my rival made in this very interesting game (from our amateur level point of view, ofc)
moves.22. Nxd7: Now R in e5 is lost. 1-0
